title: Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches with Cilantro Slaw
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches with Cilantro Slaw a try. This dairy free recipe serves 15 and costs $3.39 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 81g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 569 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 15 minutes. If you have sugar, reserved pork tenderloins, reserved chili sauce, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 78%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Pork Sandwiches with Cilantro-Jalapeno Slaw, Slow Cooker Pork Sandwiches with Cilantro Lime Slaw, and Ming Tsai's Hoisin Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches With Napa Slaw.

winePairing.pairingText: Pork Tenderloin on the menu? Try pairing with Malbec, Pinot Noir, and Sangiovese. Pinot noir's light body is great for lean cuts, medium bodied sangiovese complement meaty sauces, stews, and other multi-ingredient dishes, and full-bodied tannic malbec pairs with fatty cuts and barbecue. You could try La Celia Pioneer Malbec. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: La Celia Pioneer Malbec
productMatches.description: The 2017 Finca La Celia Pioneer Malbec is an attractive wine with aromas of fresh and ripe fruit, in perfect harmony with the delicacy of the violets and oak aging notes. Very good attack on the palate, with fruity concentration, typical of Malbec, palate medium firm but at the same time elegant. It is an ideal Malbec to drink with the Argetine roast beef with typical “empanadas”.

instructions: In a bowl, combine the cabbage, cilantro, vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, and a few grinds of pepper. Heat the Chili Sauce in the microwave or in a saucepan over low heat. Divide the pork among the rolls. Top each with some Chili Sauce, Cilantro Slaw, and tomato slices.

steps.step: In a bowl, combine the cabbage, cilantro, vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, and a few grinds of pepper.
Heat the Chili Sauce in the microwave or in a saucepan over low heat. Divide the pork among the rolls. Top each with some Chili Sauce, Cilantro Slaw, and tomato slices.
